The Roxbury High School Preschool Program has been serving the community since 1973 and has two preschool programs, one for three-year-olds and one for four-year-olds. Due to the impending storm and the Governor's declaration of a state of emergency, Roxbury Public Schools will be closed tomorrow, Wednesday, March 21st. As a result, Spring Break will be fully reinstated and the extra snow days will now be added to the end of the school year. However, High School Graduation will remain the same. A letter with detailed information will be available on the school website and distributed through Genesis by Monday.

Stay warm and be safe, Roxbury.

ROXBURY SCHOOLS ANNOUNCEMENT 3/4/18:

Message from Roxbury Superintendent Loretta Radulic

Due to continued power outages and road closures, we are going to delay Roxbury Public Schools for tomorrow Monday, March 5th.

At this point, we have one school without power in the district, Nixon elementary school. In addition, the HS will have reduced lunch options due to power issues in the kitchen area. We have plans in place to make accommodations in both situations.

We will be receiving updated information from the police, DPW, OEM and JCP & L by 5pm this evening.

If you don't hear from me, plan on a delay for Monday. Details for Nixon elementary students and HS students will be send out by the principals this evening.

Our thoughts are with all of those without power. Have a good afternoon.
